result.execSummary:
The defendant David A Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation and extended supervision now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant shall have absolutely no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, by any electronic means, telephone or through any other person, with Michael Johnson, Mrs. Michael Johnson, their children, their residence, work or school.  No contact with the residence at 905 Harrison St., Black River Falls, WI.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent. 

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Defendant shall be subject to random alcohol and drug testing by his agent.

Comply with a mental health assessment and follow any treatment and/or counseling recommendations.

Credit if revoked, to be determined.

records.addlTxt:
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Poss.  Victim is present.  Parties have the revocation packet.  No changes or corrections noted.  Victim made a victim impact statement.  State recommended:  15CM85. 2 years total.  18 months initial confinement 6 months extended supervision.  15CM149.  2 years total.  18 months initial confinement 6 months extended supervision.   Consecutive to 15CM85.  15CM156.  2 years total.  18 months initial confinement 6 months extended supervision. Both counts concurrent, but consecutive to the other cases.  15CM263  2 years total.  18 months initial confinement 6 months extended supervision.  Both counts concurrent with each other but, consecutive to the other cases.   Sentence credit 451 days. Concurrent with sentence now serving in 11CF196.   Defense recommended:  90 days jail 15CM85 and 15CM156.  9 months jail on 15CM149 and 15CM263.  451 days credit.  Adopt recommendation of the agent.  

Court ordered:  

15CM85:  2 years total.  18 months initial confinement 6 months extended supervision.  Concurrent to 11CF196.  Credit for 
15CM149: 2 years total.  18 months initial confinement 6 months extended supervision.   Concurrent to 11CF196 but consecutive to 15CM85.  Credit for 
15CM156: 2 years total.  18 months initial confinement 6 months extended supervision. Both counts concurrent and concurrent with 11CF196,  but consecutive to 15CM185 and 15CM149.  
15CM263: 2 years total.  18 months initial confinement 6 months extended supervision.  Both counts concurrent with each other, and concurrent with 11CF196 , consecutive to 15CM85, 15CM149 and 15CM156.   Civil judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.    Eligible for SAP.  Not eligible for CIP.  Stipulation as to sentence credit will be filed.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 24, 2017 at 09:00 am.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Poss.  Schedule SEHR.
Status conference on August 7, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for David A Johnson

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, no counsel present.  He thought his former attorney would represent him.  He will proceed without an attorney.  Court questioned him on his waiver of attorney.  He understood.  He will proceed without an attorney.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently waived his right to counsel.  Defendant has a copy of the revocation order and warrant and summary.  He read it. It is accurate.  Victim is present and made a statement to the court.  State recommended:  15CM85. 2 years total.  18 months initial confinement 6 months extended supervision.  239 days credit.  15CM149.  2 years total.  18 months initial confinement 6 months extended supervision.   15CM156.  2 years total.  18 months initial confinement 6 months extended supervision. Both counts concurrent, but consecutive to the other cases.  15CM263  2 years total.  18 months initial confinement 6 months extended supervision.  Both counts concurrent with each other but, consecutive to the other cases.  Defendant thinks he is in over his head.  He wants an attorney.   Court advised the defendant to contact SPD.  STC set for 8/7 at 3 pm.  Defendant does not need to appear.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 28, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
with summary attached.
from DOC

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Dominguez.  Defendant plead no contest to the charge.  Repeater allegation confirmed.  Court advised the defendant of the charge and possible penalties he plead to.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, elements and constitutional rights with the defendant.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights and entered his plea.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty as charged.  Court made record clear as to the repeater allegation.   Defendant confirmed.   Attorney Dominguez also confirmed repeaters are accurate.  State recommended:  6 months jail, concurrent.  CC and DNA surcharge.  Jail to start immediately.  Defense recommended 3 months, concurrent.  Allow to go to in-patient treatment during jail term, and allow the treatment to count toward jail sentence.  Defendant elected to exercise his right to allocution.  Court asked if probation was considered.  Attorney Dominguez said defendant would accept probation.  Defendant also confirmed he would accept probation.

Court ordered:  sentence withheld 3 years probation.  Concurrent.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  No contact whatsoever with the M.J.  victim,  the victim's family or their residence, place of work or school.  No contact with 905 Harrison St. Black River Falls, residence.  Comply with a mental health assessment and comply with any recommended treatment and/or counseling.  CC.  Random drug and alcohol testing.  s/m employment. Credit to be determined.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-15-2015 09:00 am
